message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.AI 

This paper discusses the network layer perspective of vehicular communications, which involves the exchange of information among vehicles, pedestrians, and infrastructures. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the safety applications of vehicular communications, which falls under the sub-category cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The use of communication techniques and routing protocols in vehicular networks can be categorized under cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also mentions the potential of vehicular communications to support intelligent transportation, which can be classified under cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper discusses the use of vehicular communications to support infotainment services, which can be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
